@rahod $UPST @DanPena2 $AAPL $TSLA

Ooops!  This accidentally got posted on the main pages instead of the comments.  My bad.  Sentiment remains the same. 

 No emotions my friend.  Corruption in the market is now at the forefront.  The DOJ has launched this expansive investigation - not the SEC.  What does that tell you?  Do you understand?  If not you may consider doing more research on this subject.

As far as my personal emotions in the market.  I have none - and is irrelevant.

This is why it matters to the DOJ.  And if you can take a hint - guess who else is under investigation.  The SEC.  Don't take my words or my links for it.  Do your own research & draw your own conclusions. 

https://www.reuters.com/markets/us/what-is-short-selling-why-does-doj-care-2021-12-14/

links.title: Explainer: What is short-selling and why does the DoJ care?
links.description: Dec 14 (Reuters) - Short-selling, a bearish investing practice, has become a target of an expansive U.S. Department of Justice criminal investigation. The DoJ has issued subpoenas as it examines short-selling by hedge funds and their relationships with research firms that publish negative reports on certain companies, according to three people familiar with the matter.

body: $BKKT We know that $AAPL controls announcements with a tight grip. Bakkt's expanding relationship for ApplePay's crypto payments will soon result in a full-scale announcement by Apple accepting crypto for payments on products and services via Bakkt. This AAPL relationship has been underway for months and there is no other crypto custodian/payments provider other than ICE-backed Bakkt who can meet AAPL's high standards for performance, compliance, and security. Will the upcoming Apple announcement launch BKKT shares to new ATHs above $60? Low-float and high SI says yes, it is likely that the AAPL deal will send BKKT shares soaring 5X from current levels. But something just as impactful happened last week under the radar. Bakkt expanded its business model to accept crypto payments for deliveries AND more importantly, Bakkt is now handling worker compensation via crypto payments. These are TWO separate, new business expansions for the rapidly growing Bakkt business model. $100 in 2022.
